decks.notes: The main concept of this deck revolves around utilizing Cloudpost lands to quickly ramp up mana and cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Chalice of the Void and Force of Will to control the game and protect your combo pieces. Additionally, cards like Stock Up and Tishana's Tidebinder help you draw through your deck quickly and find the key pieces you need to win the game. Overall, the strategy focuses on fast mana acceleration and overwhelming your opponent with massive threats.

This deck focuses on using artifacts to quickly generate mana and control the board while overwhelming the opponent with aggressive plays. It utilizes cards like Mox Opal and Mishra's Bauble to power out threats like Pinnacle Emissary and Kappa Cannoneer, while also disrupting the opponent with cards like Force of Will and Pithing Needle. The deck aims to quickly establish a board presence and put pressure on the opponent, using powerful artifact synergies to maintain momentum and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

Utilizing a combination of artifacts, disruptive spells, and card advantage, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays while generating value through powerful synergies. By leveraging cards like Karn, the Great Creator, Chalice of the Void, and The One Ring, the deck can disrupt the opponent's game plan while establishing its own powerful board presence. The inclusion of Urza's Saga and powerful artifact creatures like Phyrexian Dreadnought allows for explosive plays and a strong late-game presence. Overall, this deck looks to quickly establish dominance and close out games efficiently.

The main goal of this deck is to quickly assemble the Cephalid Illusionist and Nomads en-Kor combo to mill your library, then use Dread Return to reanimate Thassa's Oracle for a win. The deck is built around protecting and enabling this combo with cards like Force of Will, Brainstorm, and Daze, while also including utility cards like Swords to Plowshares and Prismatic Ending for removal. The inclusion of Urza's Saga provides additional value and flexibility in tutoring for key combo pieces. The deck also utilizes Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion for additional card advantage and resiliency.

This deck focuses on using aggressive creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Stoneforge Mystic to disrupt your opponent's mana base while also applying pressure. The deck also has a strong control element with cards like Swords to Plowshares and Skyclave Apparition to deal with threats. Additionally, the deck utilizes the synergy between cards like Aether Vial, Flickerwisp, and Recruiter of the Guard to create value and outgrind opponents. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion provides additional value and versatility to the deck.

The deck focuses on combining aggressive creature strategies with disruptive elements such as Thoughtseize and Swords to Plowshares. It also utilizes powerful synergies with cards like Stoneforge Mystic and Skyclave Apparition to control the board and maintain pressure on the opponent. With a mix of aggressive creatures and efficient removal, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while steadily chipping away at their life total to secure a victory. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion adds an extra layer of value and flexibility to the deck's game plan.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategies while quickly building up a board presence. It utilizes cards like Swords to Plowshares and Thoughtseize to control the opponent's creatures and hand. Aether Vial allows for quick creature deployment, while cards like Flickerwisp and Skyclave Apparition provide additional utility. The deck also has a strong recursion game with cards like Overlord of the Balemurk and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd. The mana base is designed to support the deck's aggressive playstyle while also providing disruption with cards like Karakas and Wasteland.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan by using taxing effects like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Spirit of the Labyrinth, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Stoneforge Mystic and Skyclave Apparition. The deck also utilizes Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play and protect them with Mother of Runes and Giver of Runes. It aims to control the tempo of the game by utilizing powerful equipment like Batterskull and Kaldra Compleat, while disrupting the opponent's mana base with cards like Wasteland and Rishadan Port. This deck aims to apply pressure and disrupt the opponent's strategy to secure a victory.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the combo pieces needed to cast Doomsday, a powerful sorcery that allows the player to rearrange their deck in a way that guarantees them victory. The deck includes various ways to filter through the deck, protect against disruption with countermagic, and generate mana quickly to execute the combo. Thassa's Oracle serves as a win condition once the Doomsday combo is set up, allowing the player to win the game on the spot. The deck aims to be efficient and resilient in executing its combo strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly deploy disruptive threats such as Magus of the Moon and Chalice of the Void, while also utilizing fast mana acceleration like Chrome Mox and Simian Spirit Guide. The deck aims to lock out opponents from playing their spells with Chalice of the Void and disrupt their mana base with Magus of the Moon, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Goblin Rabblemaster. Additionally, it has the potential to close out games quickly with its powerful finishers like Sundering Eruption and Agatha's Soul Cauldron.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly disrupt the opponent's mana base by playing cards like Magus of the Moon and Blood Moon. This allows the player to take advantage of their own fast mana sources like Simian Spirit Guide and Chrome Mox to play powerful threats like Dragon creatures and finish the game quickly with cards like Fury and Sundering Eruption. The deck aims to lock down the opponent's options while applying pressure with aggressive creatures and powerful spells, making it difficult for them to recover and win against this aggressive strategy.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive Eldrazi creatures to overwhelm the opponent and disrupt their game plan. By utilizing powerful Eldrazi creatures like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer, along with mana acceleration from cards like Lotus Petal and Simian Spirit Guide, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early and close out the game quickly. Chalice of the Void helps to disrupt the opponent's spells, while lands like Cavern of Souls and Eye of Ugin provide additional mana efficiency and creature support. Overall, the deck aims to be fast, resilient, and efficient in its aggressive strategy.

This Grixis Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy through a combination of removal spells, counter spells, and hand disruption. It also utilizes powerful creatures and planeswalkers to control the board and generate card advantage. The mana base is designed to support a variety of spells and ensure that the deck can consistently cast its spells. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by making efficient trades and managing resources effectively to eventually grind out a win.

The deck focuses on utilizing a diverse array of human creatures to apply pressure on the opponent quickly. By having a mix of aggressive creatures, disruptive elements like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, and protection cards like Karakas, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can set up their own game plan. The inclusion of Mox Amber and Chrome Mox allows for faster mana acceleration, while cards like Banish to Another Universe provide removal options. The deck's strength lies in its ability to maintain a fast and proactive strategy against a variety of opponents.

This Legacy combo deck focuses on assembling powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn, while using cards like Lim-Dl's Vault and Brainstorm to dig through the deck for key pieces. With disruption in the form of Thoughtseize and Force of Will, alongside protection from Parker Luck, the deck aims to set up its win condition quickly and efficiently. By utilizing cards like Lotus Petal and Vesuvan Drifter, the deck can generate mana and card advantage to overwhelm opponents and secure the win.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by maximizing the use of lands and Landfall abilities. It utilizes cards like Urza's Saga, Wasteland, and Life from the Loam to control the opponent's resources while generating advantage through tokens and extra land drops. Crop Rotation is used to find specific utility lands like Karakas or The Tabernacle at Pendrell Vale. The deck also includes cards like Sphere of Resistance and Malevolent Rumble to slow down the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while setting up a powerful late-game win condition with cards like Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage.

The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy by utilizing cards like Thoughtseize, Smallpox, and Malevolent Rumble while leveraging the synergy between Life from the Loam and cards like Wasteland and Urza's Saga to control the board and generate value. It also has a graveyard recursion strategy with Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis and Grist, the Hunger Tide. The inclusion of cards like Zuran Orb and Nihil Spellbomb provides additional utility and flexibility in responding to different threats, making it a versatile control deck with a focus on resource management and attrition.

The deck focuses on aggressive creatures and early disruption effects to control the game and pressure the opponent. It utilizes a combination of powerful creatures like Orcish Bowmasters and Voice of Victory alongside disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Swords to Plowshares. The inclusion of cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Goblin Bombardment provide additional reach and ways to close out the game quickly. The mana base is built around providing consistent access to all three colors, while also including utility lands like Wasteland and Karakas to disrupt the opponent's game plan.

This Merfolk deck focuses on flooding the board with aggressive creatures like Lord of Atlantis and Master of the Pearl Trident, while protecting them with counter spells like Force of Will and Daze. The key strategy is to use Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play and disrupt the opponent's plans with cards like Merfolk Trickster and Tide Shaper. The deck aims to establish board presence quickly and overwhelm the opponent with evasive threats like True-Name Nemesis. The inclusion of Wasteland helps to disrupt the opponent's mana base and gain an advantage in the tempo of the game.

The key strategy of this deck is to quickly assemble the combo pieces needed to execute a lethal combo involving Cephalid Illusionist, Dread Return, and Thassa's Oracle. The deck aims to efficiently dig through the library using cards like Ponder and Brainstorm, while also disrupting opponent's plays with cards like Force of Will and Sink into Stupor. The inclusion of cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Aphetto Alchemist further support the combo strategy by providing additional card advantage and protection. The goal is to win the game in a single explosive turn using a well-timed combination of cards.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana to cast powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn, Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath, and Atraxa, Grand Unifier using cards like Lotus Petal and Show and Tell. The deck also includes counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce to protect the combo pieces. Cunning Wish allows for additional flexibility and access to specific sideboard cards. The goal is to cheat out big creatures early and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats, utilizing the combo potential of Omniscience and Stock Up for explosive plays.

The deck aims to win the game in a single turn by milling all cards from the library, then using Dread Return to bring back Thassa's Oracle and win the game with its enter-the-battlefield effect. The deck uses a combination of mana acceleration cards like Lotus Petal and Simian Spirit Guide, and combo enablers like Balustrade Spy and Undercity Informer to quickly execute the game-winning combo. It also includes disruption elements like Pact of Negation, Surgical Extraction, and Cabal Therapy to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on control through a combination of countering spells, removing threats, and disrupting the opponent's game plan. It aims to stall the game and prevent the opponent from executing their strategy, while also setting up its own win condition with Phyrexian Dreadnought. The deck includes a mix of powerful control cards like Force of Will and Stifle, along with card advantage engines like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. The mana base is built around fetching specific lands and disrupting the opponent's mana base with Wasteland.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Thoughtseize, and then bringing them back into play with spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead. It also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo and control the game. The key strategy is to use powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier to overpower the opponent while also having access to versatile threats like Brazen Borrower and Murktide Regent. The deck aims to win the game by overwhelming the opponent with its powerful reanimated creatures.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, then using cards like Reanimate and Animate Dead to bring them back onto the battlefield for a low cost. It also includes disruption with cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to protect the combo and control the opponent's plays. The deck's strategy revolves around fast and efficient reanimation of high impact creatures to overwhelm the opponent and secure a win.

This deck focuses on using powerful reanimation spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead to cheat massive threats like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier into play early in the game. The deck also utilizes disruptive spells like Thoughtseize, Force of Will, and Daze to protect its combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The mana base is designed to provide consistent access to the necessary colors of mana while also incorporating utility lands like Wasteland and Undercity Sewers to disrupt the opponent's mana base.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures through cards like Entomb and Thoughtseize, then bringing them back to the battlefield with Reanimate and Animate Dead. It also uses disruptive elements like Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with big threats like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, while controlling the game with powerful planeswalkers like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. The deck aims to win the game through a combination of efficient reanimation and disruptive spells.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with high-power creatures like Griselbrand and Murktide Regent, then using cards like Entomb and Reanimate to bring them back onto the battlefield at a reduced cost. With a mix of control spells like Force of Will and disruption from Thoughtseize, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm opponents with powerful creatures and win the game before the opponent has a chance to set up their own strategy. The deck is designed to be fast and explosive, aiming to win the game through a powerful combo before the opponent can react.
